intro: Doselia, commonly known as the "false lily," is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound leaves that are often finely divided. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Doselia is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
